title: Social Media For Blockchains
description: A medida que el mundo de las criptomonedas siga expandiéndose y haciéndose más interoperable, se necesitarán personas con conocimientos de blockchain.

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea is much validated but the proposal lacks of content. 
First, it would be nice to have an idea on the potential market size (how many people) it could reach, to assess its true potential.
I'd start highlighting the problems he sees with the existing platforms (linkedin) with more decription; Saying its too crowded is not enough and doesnt convince anyone. The needed funcionalities that dont exist and the disadvantages need to be clear in the problem statement.

In addition, it could be outlined here what services the platform will provide and how it could benefits both employers and employees (look automatically for matches, profile data analysis, suggestions to improve resume, communication of courses). Some brainstorm/ideation sessions could be made with stakeholders (key potential users, proposers, companies, etc) to ellaborate more on that. Its good to have clear how it would differ from linkedin and what are the specifics advantages to the crypto/blockchain world.

It's also nice to bring what business model it would be adopted. The standards for this kind of platforms is the "freemium" but others could be tried.

Last, as it is already stated in proposal the main objective here is not get funded but to learn how to ellaborate the proposal (for future actual funds) I dont see it is already ready to become a catalyst project. However, its in the right path, as the idea is good! This project looks very adequate to apply an agile metholody and develop the tool with the stakeholders, creating the new funcionalities in each sprint and validating with them.
f6_assessments.q1:
Very vague experience and only one person apparently committed. It would be nice to se how the proposer is active in cardano community to validate its knowledge in this world and what is his graduation background to see where he needs to complement the team (if its a dev background he'll probably need a person with business experience and vice-versa). Linkedin links or any other reference to verify team information are always appreciated!

In regard to the plan, it exists and is time-framed but its too poor in details. Its necessary to see all the steps in development of the tool/platform, its validation/test in a pilot and its roll out plan, linked to the communication and business plan.

The budget breakdown is simple but as it seems to pay only for working hours of 3 weeks its fine.
f6_assessments.q2: There are some milestones that could be taken from the plan its too little. No kpis stated. As metrics, I'd mention the numbers os users in the MVP, the number % of growth once platform is implemented, the number of funcionalities developed.

f6_assessments.q0: A decentralized Linkedin would have definetly some advantages.  The execution part of it seems to be a bit lacking but since the plan ist to conduct 3 weeks research I understand that this is an early stage proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The likelyhood that the proposer will conduct 3 weeks research is quite hard to assess. What maybe would have helped is to already formulate a draft on wich points and goals the research will be conducted (like a short research-roadmap). I think also it can be underestimated how much work to build a decentralized social media would need.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is kept quite short and it is hard to assess how much time the proposer will spend on it e.g. if he underestimated the time of research needed. Also since it is a broad subject it would have helped to provide some points to audit how the research went.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer does not make a direct link between their proposal and the challenge brief. This app could potentially be used to onboard new members, but this link should be made and fleshed out by the proposer rather than the assessor.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer hasn't provided their skillset or relevant experience. The roadmap indicates that the proposer would like to be funded for a brainstorm intended to develop this idea further, rather than app development. There is no prior work to help us estimate if this proposer is up to running such an ambitious tool. This project has a big goal and the proposal doesn't address any of the technical, marketing, or team building dimensions of building a job resume website.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal does not have the concrete relevant information or measurable success indicators to make this auditable. If the only measure of success is a proposal in a later cycle, that doe not give us much to go on.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal does not articulate how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem other than as a general resource for the crypto community.  It proposes dapp for a LinkedIn style website, but does not specify how it will utilize any Cardano features.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal does not specifically state the proposers qualifications other than being a "graduating student."  The school and major are not listed.  The proposal is to create a proposal, not an end in itself.   It is not a good use of funds to pay for the proposal process, as other proposers do not have this benefit.
f6_assessments.q2: The timeline and success definition is not covered by the funding requested, the funding requested is only intended for creating a subsequent proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a good proposal. However, the statement of what problem is to be solved remains vague. Cardano will have a narrow benefit from this proposal because the proposal is directed to blockchain (a whole entity comprising of sub-entities) rather than Cardano which is just one of the blockchains in the world. The goals of the proposal are not expressly stated so it makes it difficult to ascertain whether it fits into the challenge settings or not.
